intro: Marsdenia squamulosa, commonly known as the squamulose Marsdenia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. It is often found in forested areas and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
